RNAlysis quick-start video guideïƒ

Launching RNAlysisïƒ

Open the graphical user interface by running rnalysis-gui in your terminal or executing gui.run_gui() in a Python console.

Importing Dataïƒ

Select a file from your computer and click â€˜Startâ€™ to import it into RNAlysis.

Exploring Your Datasetïƒ

View an overview of your data, including table name, type, and dimensions. Use the â€˜View full tableâ€™ button for a comprehensive look.

Applying Filtersïƒ

Select a filtering function, adjust parameters, and click â€˜Applyâ€™ to modify your table. Changes wonâ€™t affect the original file until saved.

Undo the operations you applied to your dataïƒ

Use the â€˜Command historyâ€™ window to undo or redo operations applied to your table at any time.

Apply your operations â€˜in-placeâ€™ or make a copyïƒ

Apply operations â€˜in-placeâ€™ or to a copy of your table in a new tab, leaving the original unmodified.

Generating and Saving Visualizationsïƒ

Create graphs of your data, resize them, and save in various file formats for further use or presentation.

Analyze Multiple Tables at the Same Timeïƒ

Open new tabs to work on multiple tables simultaneously, enhancing your analytical capabilities.

Organizing Your Workspaceïƒ

Sort tabs and customize their colors to efficiently manage your analytical workspace.

Saving Modified Tablesïƒ

Click â€˜Save tableâ€™ to store the results of your filtering operations in a location of your choice.

Creating Gene Setsïƒ

Import lists of genes as Gene Sets for specialized analysis within RNAlysis.

Visualizing Gene Set Intersectionsïƒ

Use the â€˜Visualize Gene Setsâ€™ window to create Venn diagrams and UpSet plots, illustrating intersections between tables and gene sets.

Performing Set Operationsïƒ

Extract specific subsets from your data using predefined set operations or by selecting subsets in the preview pane.

Conducting Enrichment Analysisïƒ

Perform various types of enrichment analysis on your filtered tables and gene sets to gain biological insights.

Rapid Gene Information Lookupïƒ

Right-click to quickly access gene information from various biological databases, customizable in the settings menu.

Building Analysis Pipelinesïƒ

Group multiple operations with specific parameters into a Pipeline to streamline your data analysis workflow.

Executing Pipelinesïƒ

Apply Pipelines to multiple tables simultaneously, enhancing efficiency and reducing errors in your analysis.

Sharing and Reproducing Analysesïƒ

Export and share Pipelines to facilitate reproducibility and collaborative analysis across different computers.

Integrating External Bioinformatic Toolsïƒ

Access a graphical interface for various bioinformatic tools, covering stages from adapter trimming to differential expression analysis.

Leveraging Table-Specific Functionsïƒ

Specify table types when loading to access specialized functions, such as clustering analysis for count matrices.

Recovering Closed Tabsïƒ

Restore accidentally closed tabs through the â€˜Editâ€™ menu to recover your work.

Generating Interactive Analysis Reportsïƒ

Create comprehensive, interactive analysis reports with a single click, automatically including all generated tables, gene sets, and graphs.
